column5: Well after looking at the forecast....I couldn't resist calling in sick and going fishing.  I haven't taken a day off at work in months....that's how I justified it to myself....hehehe. I never got to the river until 11:00 A.M. and it wasn't completely blown out...the water looked perfect.  Not 10 seconds after I get to the river I hear the thunder....within 5 minutes it poured...and blew....and poured some more. Oh well better than being at work.  Within the first 15 minutes I hooked into these    A couple hours later my good buddy showed up and we got a few more before the river blew out.      We lost a few more....but it was sure nice to feel that spring  in the air.....finally  Jason
Very nice work guys, Im just getting the rod out and spooled up myself. Havent had time yet to go but going to make a point of doing that early next week.  Good Job!!!

Wow!!! Great job out there....too bad it rained...who know how many you would have pulled in!!!  Awesome pics and fish there.  I checked a few local tribs around 730pm last night...completely blown out....didn't even bother putting a line in the water.  This work thing sure does get in the way doesn't it?  LOL.  Good on you for heading out...great results!
good work, some nice fish you got there.
Nice trout pics, congrats on a successful outing...  Mike
wow - question is - do i go steelheading in the morning, or chase pike before the season closes.....I WAS going to go for pike....thanks for making my life difficult! haha  Great report!  TUF
hey i know that cut off branch  LOL nice fish guys!!
That's what we're talking about Basskicker!  Good job,  Thanks for the post.
Well...done,and yes you are right...it was worth a day off work,and its even better when the fish are hitting well....cheers
